name: Adam Doupé
content: Home - Adam DoupÃ© I am an Associate Professor in the School of Computing and Augmented Intelligence at Arizona State University. I am also Director of the Center for Cybersecurity and Trusted Foundations in the Global Security Initiative at Arizona State University. I am also Faculty Advisor of the ASU Hacking Club, a hacking club at ASU, and I play CTFs with Shellphish In addition, I am a Founding Member of the Order of the Overflow, prior hosts of DEF CON CTF (Quals and Finals) 2018–2021. My research focuses on automated vulnerability analysis, binary analysis, web security, cybercrime, underground economies, cybersecurity education, mobile security, network security, telephony security, and hacking competitions. I am the co-Director of the Laboratory of Security Engineering For Future Computing (SEFCOM) along with Dr. Gail-Joon Ahn, Dr. Yan Shoshitaishvili, Dr. Ruoyu (Fish) Wang, and Dr. Tiffany Bao. I host a series of live hacking of CTF challenges on YouTube and post almost all of my courses on YouTube. Finally, Yan and I host a weekly cybersecurity podcast focused on Capture the Flag (CTF) called CTF Radiooo. Contact Mail: P.O. Box 878809 Tempe, AZ 85287-8809 Office: BYENG 472 699 S Mill Ave. Tempe, AZ 85281 Map doupe@asu.edu GPG Key @adamd@defcon.social on on Mastodon Recent News Our paper on revisiting SDN resilience in cloud and enterprise environments was accepted for publication at the ACM Cloud Computing Security Workshop (CCSW) 2025 Our paper on compromising kernel integrity by turning system registers against the system was accepted for publication at the USENIX Security Symposium 2025 Our paper on investigating the complexities of scientific collaboration and privilege management within research computing infrastructures was accepted for publication at the IEEE Symposium on Security and Privacy 2025 Our paper on explainable large language model-based fraudulent shopping website detection was accepted for publication at AAAI 2025 Our paper on piercing the veil of fraudulent shopping website campaigns was accepted for publication at NDSS 2025 Our paper on efficient deployment of coarse-grained browser fingerprints for web-scale detection of fraud browsers was accepted for publication at IMC 2024 Our paper on uncovering occluded future vulnerabilities via robust fuzzing was accepted for publication at the ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS) 2024 Our paper on exploring the phishing attack reporting ecosystem was accepted for publication at the International Symposium on Research in Attacks, Intrusions and Defenses (RAID) 2024 Our paper on compiler-aware structuring algorithms for binary decompilation was accepted for publication at the USENIX Security Symposium 2024 Our paper on understanding the digital threats and safety practices of OnlyFans creators was accepted for publication at the USENIX Security Symposium 2024 Our paper on scalable discovery of taint-style vulnerabilities in binary firmware services was accepted for publication at the USENIX Security Symposium 2024 Our paper on grey-box database-aware web scanning for stored XSS was accepted for publication at the USENIX Security Symposium 2024
